Visualization (Dash)¶

Interactively visualize data using a basic Dash data app.

Dash is a framework for rapidly building data apps in Python (and other languages). It is built on top of Plotly.

The Dashboard is built by first converting the two dataframes to Dash datatables. We then define the layout of our Dash app and return it. There also are multiple methods returning “style dictionaries” that are used as parameters to customize parts of the Dash dashboard.

data.visualization.column_width(df: DataFrame) → dict¶

Returns conditional formatting dictionary for column widths.

data.visualization.dash(df1: DataFrame, df2: DataFrame) → <dash.dash.Dash object at 0x000002CDCDA2BC10>¶

Creates an interactive Dashboard with 2 sortable tables.

The style.css in the assets directory sets the dashboards background color and the properties of the html.H2 object.

Parameters:

  • df1 – Pandas dataframe of summarized damage done.

  • df2 – Pandas dataframe of summarized healing done.

Returns:

Object of Dash class which can then be run on localhost.

data.visualization.data_bars(df: DataFrame, column: str) → dict¶

Conditional formatting for data bars in cells.

Creates a conditional formatting dictionary that shows data bars inside of (data-)table cells. Bar lengths are relative to the highest value.

Note

This method was taken from the official dash documentation and slightly adjusted.

Parameters:

  • df – The pandas dataframe in question.

  • column – The name of the column where bars are shown.

Returns:

A dictionary of conditional formatting that can be used to style a dash DataTable.

data.visualization.df_to_dt(df: DataFrame, id: str) → DataTable¶

Converts dataframe into DataTable, using previously defined styles.

data.visualization.layout(app: Dash, tbl1: DataTable, tbl2: DataTable) → <dash.dash.Dash object at 0x000002CDCFFBFAC0>¶

Creates the layout of the dash application.

data.visualization.parse_colors(df: DataFrame) → dict¶

Conditional formatting for parse colors.

Creates a conditional formatting dictionary that changes the colors of values in the “Parse %” column dependend on their value. I am used to seeing those colors on the original website, that’s why we implement them here aswell.

Parameters:

df – The pandas dataframe in question.

Returns:

A dictionary of conditional formatting that can be used to style a dash DataTable.

data.visualization.styles(type: str) → dict¶

Returns dictionary of styles as specified by “type”.

fflogs-scraping
